entry.title: Developing Mobile Apps with AI Agents: Introducing the MCP Server for mobile development kit
entry.content:
Are you an experienced developer working on mobile app projects based on SAP Mobile Development Kit (MDK)? Do you want to jumpstart your mobile app development with MDK?  Do you use AI agents such as Cursor, Cline, OpenCode, or GitHub Copilot to support you in your daily work? Wouldn't it be cool if the agent could help you develop MDK applications? We now offer some free tools that can provide more context about your project as well as relevant MDK examples to steer the AI coding assistant in doing the right thing.

Figure 1: High level overview MDK MCP Server

 We are excited to announce the release of the MCP server for mobile development kit. This open-source server provides AI agents with comprehensive MDK knowledge and tools. By combining best practice guidelines, project-aware context information, templates for creating new projects, and access to the MDK CLI tools, the MDK MCP server transforms AI agents into MDK development experts.

The code repository is located at  https://github.com/SAP/mdk-mcp-server

This MDK specific release follows previously announced MCP servers by SAP for:

  • CAP
  • Fiori
  • UI5

What is an MCP Server?

An Model Context Protocol (MCP) server is designed to manage and deliver capabilities to Large Language Models (LLMs) via AI agents. It bridges the gap between LLMs and external resources such as services, tools, and data, enabling LLMs to interact with these resources.

What is mobile development kit?

The SAP Mobile Development Kit (MDK) is a powerful framework that enables developers to build cross-platform mobile applications using a metadata-driven approach. It is part of SAP Business Technology Platform and integrates tightly with SAP Mobile Services.

Some of SAP‚Äôs larger and complex mobile apps are built using MDK. An example is SAP Service and Asset Manager.

Why should you use this MCP server?

The newly introduced MCP server for mobile development kit transforms AI agents into MDK development experts. It provides context-focused tools that aim to help the AI agent to answer questions such as:

  • Finding examples of using an MDK component.
  • Retrieving details about specific properties of an MDK component.
  • Finding the schema for a specific MDK component.
  • Searching MDK documentation.

Other reasons for using this MCP server:

  • Large Language Models (LLMs) sometimes lack information on the latest best practices and metadata recommended for MDK development.
  • They might recommend the use of MDK metadata that does not exist in the version your project is using, or MDK metadata that has been marked as deprecated.
  • By facilitating MDK validation tools, your coding agent can validate the changes it has made, ensuring it follows current best practices.
  • Scaffolding tools can help agents kickstart new projects faster and with established patterns, saving token costs.

The MCP server can help you answer questions you as a developer have about the project you are working on, such as:

  • Explain what this specific file does in the MDK project structure.
  • How can I use Fragments in my project?
  • Can this application support offline capabilities?
  • Are there any requirements for the data source to support offline?

Combining AI agents with existing tools ‚Äì a powerful and efficient combination

Instead of relying fully on what an AI agent can generate, we offer the agent access to existing tools in our MDK toolset.

Figure 2: Tools used by the MCP Server for mobile development kit

With MDK tools, we can migrate, validate, build and deploy projects. With the MDK Generator, we provide project scaffolding for Base, Empty, List-Detail and CRUD templates. Based on your prompts, we can further generate pages and actions to your MDK project. This ensures a more predictable outcome, saves time and tokens (costs).

Open Source

We are also happy to announce that the MCP Server for mobile development kit is an open-source project, licensed under the Apache-2.0 license. Learn more about open source at SAP.

We are curious to see what you will do with our MCP server for mobile development kit ! Please do not hesitate to provide your feedback here or report any issues in our GitHub repository.

Setup

Assuming you have already installed node.js on your machine, first install Yeoman. This must be an older version of Yeoman to avoid compatibility issues.

npm install -g yo@4.3.1

For installing the MDK MCP server, we will soon offer a way to install it from npmjs. Until then, please use the following steps to clone the open-source code repository at https://github.com/SAP/mdk-mcp-server, and use npm to install it:

git clone https://github.com/SAP/mdk-mcp-server.git
cd mdk-mcp-server
npm i --include=optional

npm i -g /mdk-mcp-server@.‚Äã

Both MDK Tools (@sap/mdk-tools) as well as MDK Generator (@sap/generator-mdk) will automatically be installed as dependencies of the MCP server for mobile development kit.

Next, your MCP client (AI agent) needs to be configured to make use of the server. Depending on the AI agent used, the configuration looks a little different. We are still waiting for alignment across AI agents regarding this kind of configuration.

In general, the mcpServers configuration should include the following section:

     "mdk-mcp": {
      "command": "mdk-mcp",
      "args": []
    }


Once installed, the AI agent in your IDE will automatically gain access to the MDK MCP server and can start using the tools at its own discretion. Depending on your IDE and settings, you may need to approve the first tool calls.

Figure 3: MCP Servers configuration in Cline

 

Rules

The following rules help guide the agent to use the server correctly.

## Guidelines for MDK
Don‚Äôt generate .service.metadata file
Don‚Äôt generate .xml file in ‚ÄòServices‚Äô folder
Don‚Äôt change .project.json file


Add these rules to your existing global or project-specific AGENTS.md (specifics may vary based on respective MCP client).

Figure 4: MDK specific rules configuration in Cline

 

Tools

This release of the MDK MCP server includes the following tools, which can be accessed by your AI agent:

Tool name

Description

mdk-gen-project

Generates a new MDK project in the current directory.

mdk-gen-i18n

Returns a prompt to generate i18n files for MDK project describing the texts, labels and messages.

mdk-gen-databinding-page

Returns a prompt to generate a databinding-enabled MDK page describing the page layout, controls and data bindings.

mdk-gen-layout-page

Generates a layout-based MDK page. You can describe the page layout, controls.

mdk-gen-entity

Generates CRUD or List Detail template metadata for a new entity set.

mdk-gen-action

Returns a prompt to generate an MDK action describing the action type and data bindings.

mdk-build

Build an MDK project.

mdk-deploy

Deploy an MDK project to SAP Mobile Services.

mdk-show-qrcode

Show QR code for an MDK application.

mdk-migrate

Migrate an MDK project to the latest MDK schema version.

mdk-validate

Validate an MDK project.

mdk-search-documentation

Returns the top N results from MDK documentation by semantic search, sorted by relevance.

mdk-get-component-documentation

Returns the schema of an MDK component based on the name of the component.

mdk-get-property-documentation

Returns the documentation of a specific property of an MDK component.

mdk-get-example

Returns an example usage of an MDK component.

mdk-open-mobile-app-editor

Returns instructions on how to open the Mobile App Editor to create the ‚Äú.service.metadata‚Äù file.

 

 

Integration with SAP Mobile Services

For the integration with SAP Mobile Services, the MCP server currently makes use of the Cloud Foundry CLI and a service metadata file that contains details about:

  1. The mobile application defined in the SAP Mobile Services instance.
  2. The OData service metadata of the data source used in the mobile application. This describes the data model and capabilities of the OData service.

An example of such a service metadata file (with filename ‚Äú.service.metadata‚Äù) is provided in our code repository. However, changing this file is not easy. We offer a tool to help with creating or updating this file as part of our Visual Studio Code extension: Mobile development kit extension for Visual Studio Code

How to use this tool to create or update the ‚Äú.service.metadata‚Äù file:

1. Install Mobile development kit extension for Visual Studio Code version 1.32.0 or later in your Visual Studio Code.

2. Make sure you have installed the Cloud Foundry CLI.

3. Make sure to log in to your SAP Business Technology Platform environment on Cloud Foundry. This can be done by executing the following command in a terminal window:

cf login <your target endpoint> --sso

For more details you can refer to this help documentation.

4. Open the Command Palette in Visual Studio Code and select the "MDK: Open Mobile App Editor" command.

Figure 5: MDK: Open Mobile App Editor

5. Create/Select a new/existing mobile app.

Figure 6: Mobile Application Editor in Visual Studio Code

6. Select a destination.

7. Click "Add App to Project" button.

We also offer a tool in the MCP server to provide you the above information through the agent. You can basically ask the agent how to create the ‚Äú.service.metadata‚Äù file.

In future releases we aim to enhance and further simplify the integration with SAP Mobile Services.

What can you do with this server?

The MCP server for mobile development kit works well for everyday tasks in MDK projects. It can help you refactor your code and metadata and add new features.

Important: Our MCP Server for mobile development kit is designed to support professional developers in their daily work. As with all AI-generated information, you should check the generated results carefully to avoid unintended side effects. As a professional developer, YOU are in control and responsible for the outcome.

Some examples where this MCP server can help

Update old projects

I‚Äôve opened an old project that I‚Äôve created in one of my previous blog post series. I know the MDK metadata schema is outdated and want to update it. I‚Äôll ask Cline which tool can be used for this. As you can see in the screenshot, Cline made use of the MCP server for MDK to find out which tool to be used and is now proactively asking to run the MDK migration tool.

Figure 7: Update old MDK project in Cline

Explain specific properties

In the screenshot below, I am using Cursor and asked what the property ‚ÄúAnimated‚Äù does in an Action.

Figure 8: Get explanation of a property in Cursor

Help to deploy the app

Making use of the available tools, the AI agent can help you deploy the mobile app and provide detailed information on how to install the app on your device.

Figure 9a: Deployment - validate and build the app in Cursor 

Figure 9b: Deployment - deploy and show QR code in Cursor 

Figure 9c: Deployment - Summary and installation instructions in Cursor

Conclusion

In this blog post we have introduced new tools to help professional developers in their everyday tasks developing MDK apps. We have made the tools as open as possible, to allow developers to use their favorite agentic development environment. As a developer, you should be able to develop SAP mobile apps in whatever environment you prefer to use.

We are also providing the MCP server as open source, allowing you to modify the tool to your needs and contribute enhancements.

As always, feedback is welcome to improve the blog posts, but most importantly the tools and products involved.

entry.title: Re: Unable to Change Deprecation Key in SAP S4HANA Public...
entry.content:
It is not allowed to change from a key that has deprec to the day to one that does not. 

Option 1 - create new legacy assets, reverse values off old asset and then post to the new assets.
Option 2 - create new legacy assets and transfer values from old legacy assets to new assets.

entry.title: Re: Unable to Change Deprecation Key in SAP S4HANA Public...
entry.content: the question is about changing the deprec key assigned to the legacy assets, not changing the customizing of the depreciation key.

entry.title: The Transformation Advisor: Bridging Business Challenges with Process Insights
entry.content:
What Is the Transformation Advisor?

The Transformation Advisor is an experimental innovation feature designed to help SAP Signavio users identify, understand, and act on business challenges using data-driven process intelligence.
It extracts key challenges from documents such as financial reports or manual inputs and links them directly to relevant process flows, best practices, and improvement content within the SAP Signavio ecosystem.

By doing so, the Transformation Advisor closes the gap between strategic business context and operational process management, helping users translate insights into tangible actions with just a few clicks.

How It Works

  1. Input: Upload a financial report or describe a business challenge. In the screenshots I used examples provided by SAP.

 

2. Challenge Extraction: The Transformation Advisor automatically identifies and summarizes key business challenges.

Optional Integration: Link a Process Insights tenant to enrich recommendations with process performance data. This is only possible if you have SAP Signavio Process Insights in use. 

3. Recommendation Generation: Receive tailored links to process flows, improvement opportunities, and innovation ideas. 

4. Export Results: Share insights and recommendations with stakeholders for further analysis and transformation planning.

Here you see some screenshots from a example report.

 

The Transformation Advisor represents the next step in intelligent business transformation. By combining AI-driven challenge analysis with the process intelligence of SAP Signavio, it empowers organizations to move seamlessly from identifying pain points to defining actionable improvement opportunities.

As part of the SAP Signavio Lab Space, this innovation is shaping the future of transformation management‚Äîbridging strategy and execution, and helping leaders make better decisions, faster.

Stay tuned for upcoming enhancements, including deeper integration with SAP Signavio Process Insights.

If you want to test this feature by your own: Here you find a link on how to activate the Lab Space in your SAP Signavio workspace. The SAP Signavio Lab Space functions as a co-innovation hub where customers can test new, experimental features ahead of general release.

entry.title: Re: SAP Public Cloud 2508 / Error during Upload of Pages
entry.content:
Hi @LukasKuhn

Those errors you see refer back to the fact that the page you exported the JSON file from has its original language set to German, but your target is to import it into an English tenant and therefore generating the errors. Here are a few details to consider:

  • As you mentioned, a manual recreation of the pages in your new tenant is the available option.
  • If both of your systems share the same CBC environment you have the option to use the copy function, it will ease the process.
  • What you tried with the JSON file and it not working out lies in the fact that directly editing JSON file is not supported.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: # Error when applying Format Date user response for Timestamp
entry.content: Thank you in advance for your support. In our Snowflake source system, the Invoice Date field is stored as a timestamp in the format MM/dd/yyyy hh:mm:ss AM (e.g., 05/23/2025 12:00:00 AM). I‚Äôve incorporated this field into the prompt filter using the UserResponse function. Based on the user's selection, I need to display the date in the format dd/MM/yy (e.g., 23/5/2025). I attempted to use the following expression: FormatDate(ToDate(UserResponse("From Invoice Date");"dd/MM/yy hh:mm:ss am");"dd/MM/yy") Although the expression parses successfully, the output returns a #error. I suspect the issue lies in the mismatch between the actual timestamp format and the format string used in ToDate(). Could you please advise on the correct way to format the date based on the UserResponse function?

entry.title: Re: HSN/SAC CODE FIELD MISSING IN CREATE SUPPLIER INVOICE...
entry.content:
Hell @RAHULSOMANI 

In SAP S/4HANA Public  Cloud Edition, the Create Supplier Invoice and Manage Supplier Invoices apps do not include an HSN/SAC field at the G/L line level. For India GST, FI postings are controlled by tax codes and access sequences, not HSN/SAC entries. Additionally, making HSN/SAC mandatory for FI transactions isn't supported. SAP Help Portal-India-Direct Finance Posting

What is supported by SAP

If you need to capture HSN/SAC at the line level for calculation, e-invoice, or ACR reporting, follow a PO-based process.

Maintain HSN codes for materials and SAC codes for services in the master data. When posting supplier invoices via PO/SES, the GST engine automatically applies these codes. SAP Help Portal-India-Maintain HSN/SAC Codes

If you stay with non-PO (direct FI):

Use correct FI tax codes for India; do not expect MM/SD access sequences or HSN/SAC entry at the line in the FI app. SAP Support Portal-3554262 - GST IN: FB60/FB70 not working for MM/SD access sequence - S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition - GST IN

The reason you don‚Äôt see the field

The India KBA explicitly states that HSN/SAC cannot be made mandatory in FI (FB60/Cloud equivalent), which aligns with the current behaviour of the Cloud app you are observing. SAP Support Portal-2491721 - HSN/SAC code cannot be a mandatory field in Financial transactions.

Let me know if you need further information

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: SAP Enable Now - Troubleshooting - Cannot Record
entry.content:
Dear Team,

I have a Author in our group whom was able to record in Producer initially, but after a week the recording functionality stopped completely.

Herewith the notes and errors:

  1. Error file indicating the handshake error: -RecordingAutomat::handshake_ - HANDSHAKE FAILED - switching to out of process hook
  2. No network, proxy, or antivirus settings that has been changed, to your knowledge (can anyone from IT at Aegis confirm this for us?)
  3. Method to Uninstall all existing extensions from all the browsers that has been used and reinstall from the Manager App has been done.
  4. Only one extension is installed at a time, specifically the "SAP Enable Now, desktop application recorder."
  5. Other conflicting extensions has been uninstalled.
  6. Cache has been cleared and reboot done afterwards

 

Specs:

  • Chip: Apple M2
  • Memory: 16 GB
  • macOS: Version 15.6.1 Sequoia

 

The Author is running Windows using parallels:

  • Parallels version: 26.1.1
  • Windows version: 11 Pro, 24H2 
  • OS Build: 26100.6584
  • Memory used: 6 GB

 

It might be changed after an update of the Windows version. But the Author removed windows completely and installed it again, but this didn‚Äôt solve this issue. I reiterate that he was able at first, but cannot record any longer.
Any information would be helpful!

entry.title: Re: Business Data Validation of Custom Reports using Data Transition Validation (DTV) tool
entry.content:
Hi @Umarschah 

At this moment SAP report RFBELJ10 is not part of the pre-delivered content.

You can find all the reports which are supported in 3258383 - DTV : SAP Pre- delivered Content - SAP for Me

Also, you cannot add the report manually to pre-delivered content.

A work around could be creating a custom report and then add it in Test specification and then validate.

Best Regards

Abhya

entry.title: Re: Calling SAP AI Core Orchestration v2 API from SAP Build: A Quick Fix Guide
entry.content:
Hi @martin_donadio,

In my case, I was facing the same issue, and yes, in my case the problem was I did not add the v2 before the /completion. So I changed from: https://api.ai.prod.eu-central-1.aws.ml.hana.ondemand.com/v2/inference/deployments/df381315fb2383f6 to https://api.ai.prod.eu-central-1.aws.ml.hana.ondemand.com/v2/inference/deployments/df381315fb2383f6/v2

My confusion raised because I imported the openAPI specification into SAP Build according: https://api.sap.com/api/ORCHESTRATION_API_v2/path/orchestration.v2.endpoints.create

That specification for v2 is not including in the path the /v2/orchestration. Hence, I had to force to include this v2 in the destinations of btp.

If there are two versions in the api.sap.com specification:

- https://api.sap.com/api/ORCHESTRATION_API_v2/path/orchestration.v2.endpoints.create

- https://api.sap.com/api/ORCHESTRATION_API/overview

Then, I would expect the correct /v2/orchestration path in the v2 documentation.

Kind regards,

Nata.

entry.title: Re: Adaptation editor for SAPUI5 adaptation project with VS Code - On Prem
entry.content: Looks like a problem with the ui5 version. Please change it to 1.108.47 in the ui5.yaml file (on the very bottom of the file).

entry.title: SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 FPS0 Release Highlights Part 1
entry.content:
Hello and Welcome to the SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 FPS0 Product Release Highlights!

I‚Äôm Harish Mangtani from Product Experience at SAP SE. As a Product Manager working closely with our customers and engineering teams, I‚Äôm excited to share a hands-on view of the innovations delivered in this release‚Äîdesigned to help organizations run smarter, faster, and more connected.

*NOTE: This blog is the first edition of my personal highlights from the SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 FPS0 release‚Äîfocusing on innovations I believe bring meaningful business impact across key Lines of Business. A follow-up update is planned by the end of October, where I‚Äôll expand the scope to include additional areas such as Human Capital Management (HCM) and a broader set of innovations delivered across each LoB. A dedicated Part 2 of the blog will follow, highlighting industry-specific capabilities and localization features.

This release is built on SAP‚Äôs AI-First, Suite-First strategy and continues our vision of unifying Applications, Data, and AI. What stands out is how intelligence and automation are now deeply embedded into business processes, powered by SAP Business Data Cloud and a modular, configurable ERP suite. AI and agents drive productivity, automation, and real-time analytics across the enterprise, empowering business users to make better decisions and execute with confidence.

 This release also delivers industry-specific capabilities, global coverage, extensibility, and a clean core foundation for ongoing innovation. Whether you‚Äôre in Finance, Procurement, Supply Chain, Manufacturing, Sales, Service, or Asset Management, you‚Äôll find new capabilities designed to help teams work smarter and more efficiently. This blog focuses on how these principles translate into tangible innovations‚Äîranging from intelligent agents and harmonized data products to process enhancements across key business areas‚Äîthat bring meaningful improvements to the ERP experience.

SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 refers to the latest release of our cloud ERP offering, encompassing both SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 2025 and SAP S/4HANA 2025. While both products share a common foundation, the innovation scope differs: AI-powered capabilities and intelligent agents are available exclusively in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition, while SAP S/4HANA 2025 includes core functional enhancements.

At the heart of this release is a layered architecture:

  • AI at the top, enabling intuitive user experiences and intelligent agents that automate and optimize business processes.
  • SAP Business Data Cloud at the core, providing a unified, governed data foundation that connects SAP and third-party data sources.
  • Applications at the foundation, delivering deep industry capabilities and end-to-end process integration across every line of business.

Release Planning

Here is a quick recap of the release strategy for 2023‚Äì2025, along with a definition of deliveries. This strategy is designed to help customers maximize their potential while keeping them informed about the latest innovations.

 

In the sections that follow, I‚Äôll walk through highlights across Lines of Business‚Äîstarting with Finance, and continuing through Sales, Supply Chain, Service Management, and more.

Finance

AI-Powered Innovations (AI capabilities available in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition only)

Joule Agent for Accounts Receivables*

The Joule Agent for Accounts Receivables empowers accountants to streamline the management of overdue receivables. It enables users to analyze open receivables, identify overdue payments, and receive a summary of the analysis along with recommended next steps. The agent can fetch outstanding balances, retrieve open invoices and credit memos, and provide a history of dunning activities. It also helps identify open disputes that may be impacting overdue amounts and suggests appropriate actions for managing these cases.
Read more on SAP Help Portal

*Beta Shipment, GA planned

 

 

Joule Agent for Cash Manager*

In Cash and Liquidity Management, the Joule Agent provides treasury professionals with conversational access to key financial data. Users can ask questions about current cash positions, liquidity forecasts, and bank balances. Joule responds with contextual insights and enables direct navigation to relevant apps for further action.
Read more on SAP Help Portal

*Beta Shipment, GA planned

Dispute Manager ‚Äì Incorrect Invoice (FI-CA)*

The Dispute Manager in Contract Accounting (FI-CA) integrates with Joule to guide users through the resolution of incorrect invoice disputes. Based on the dispute type‚Äîsuch as missing credit, incorrect credit, or missing payment‚ÄîJoule presents verification options and resolution steps, including reviewing contract accounts, creating or assigning credit memos, and reassigning payments.
Read more on SAP Help Portal

*Beta Shipment, GA planned

 

AI-Assisted Trade Classification Proposals

This innovation introduces a simulation app that helps teams assess how effectively the fuzzy search algorithm classifies products based on existing data. By comparing proposed trade classification numbers with those already assigned, users can evaluate the accuracy of AI-driven suggestions. Combined with the creation of product description attributes, this supports a more automated and reliable approach to global trade compliance.
Read more here
URL: https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_ON-PREMISE/f5d3e1005efd4e86acf9a65abf428082/f71f71283d8c4bce92aff58392a4bbad.html

 

BRIM: Joule for Subscription Order Management

Joule for Subscription Management streamlines the process of creating and managing subscription orders. Using AI, this intelligent agent automates the creation of subscription-based orders, reducing the time and effort typically needed to set up and maintain subscription models. It ensures that the correct terms, pricing, and billing cycles are applied by automatically analyzing customer preferences and historical data. This not only simplifies subscription management but also enhances accuracy and compliance, making it easier for businesses to scale subscription-based services. By automating these tasks, teams can focus on higher-value activities like customer engagement and strategic planning, while Joule handles the routine administrative work.

Read more info here: Joule for Subscription Order Management

Core functional innovations

Optimize cash and improve supply chain resilience with SAP Taulia integration

Receivables Financing with SAP Taulia provides businesses with a streamlined way to unlock working capital by financing receivables. The integration of SAP S/4HANA with SAP Taulia automates the process of securing financing for outstanding invoices, giving businesses faster access to cash without the need for complex negotiations or third-party intermediaries. This solution simplifies cash flow management by enabling organizations to sell their receivables and receive early payment, while also providing suppliers with the option to get paid sooner. By reducing the need for traditional lines of credit, businesses can improve liquidity, mitigate financial risk, and enhance supplier relationships‚Äîall while maintaining control over their receivables.

Read more info here: Receivables Financing with SAP Taulia

 

Sales

AI-Powered Innovations (AI capabilities available in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition only)

Faster Insights into Sales Order Fulfillment Process Using Joule

With Joule integrated into the sales order fulfillment process, businesses gain faster insights into potential issues, helping resolve fulfillment challenges quickly. The AI-powered agent proactively analyzes sales order data, identifying potential bottlenecks and inconsistencies in real-time. It automatically provides recommendations for field changes and suggests actions to resolve fulfillment issues, ensuring that orders are processed without unnecessary delays. By using Joule, sales teams can respond to order fulfillment challenges faster, reducing manual intervention and enhancing customer satisfaction with timely deliveries. This intelligent automation improves the overall efficiency of the order-to-cash cycle and ensures a smoother experience for both customers and internal teams.

Read more info here: Faster Insights into Sales Order Fulfillment

 

Streamlining Solution Quotations Process Using Joule

With Joule, the process of managing and releasing solution quotations becomes faster and more efficient. The AI-powered agent automates key steps such as fetching solution quotation details, releasing and accepting quotations, and ensuring that all necessary information is up to date. By analyzing historical data and customer preferences, Joule makes intelligent recommendations to streamline the approval and modification processes, reducing manual effort and minimizing delays. This leads to quicker turnaround times for your sales teams, ensuring that customers receive accurate and timely quotations, which in turn can accelerate the sales cycle. Whether it's fetching information or managing approval workflows, Joule helps businesses handle solution quotations seamlessly, driving efficiency and improving overall sales performance.

Read more info here: Streamlining Solution Quotations Process Using Joule
Fetch Solution Quotation Information

Core functional innovations

Navigation to NAST Output Control in the SAP Fiori Apps for Sales Order and Billing

The new feature in SAP Fiori apps ‚ÄúManage Sales Orders (Version 2)‚Äù and ‚ÄúManage Billing Documents‚Äù enables seamless navigation to NAST output control, allowing users to quickly access output documents for sales orders and billing. This integration makes it easier for users to view the PDV version of documents like order confirmations and invoices directly within the apps, improving visibility and accessibility. By providing a single-point access to critical output documents, businesses can streamline their processes, saving time and reducing manual effort. This enhances operational efficiency by simplifying document management and accelerating processing times, ultimately improving the overall sales and billing workflow.

Read more info here: Navigation to NAST Output Control in SAP Fiori Apps

 One-Step Payment Before Sales Order or Delivery is Created

The One-Step Payment feature allows businesses to collect payments before the sales order or delivery is created, improving cash flow and simplifying the sales process. With the SAP Digital Payments add-on, payments are initiated directly through the payment service provider (PSP), such as in a web shop, and payment details are transferred directly into the sales and finance applications. This streamlines the settlement process, ensuring a smooth match between the payment and the liability. It also allows businesses to handle refunds through credit memos when necessary, accelerating digital payments and reducing the time it takes for customers to pay before goods are shipped.

Read more info here: One-Step Payment Before Sales Order or Delivery

The New Business Role: Solution Business Specialist

The Solution Business Specialist role provides users with the tools to manage solution-based selling processes, spanning the entire sales lifecycle. This role includes access to SAP Fiori apps that help in the creation, processing, and monitoring of solution orders, which is especially valuable for handling complex sales scenarios such as bundled offerings or project-based solutions. By linking the role to specific workflows and tasks, it streamlines the sales process, improves collaboration between sales, delivery, and billing teams, and ensures that users can manage solution orders more efficiently.

Read more info here: The New Business Role: Solution Business Specialist

 

Supply Chain

AI-Powered Innovations (AI capabilities available in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition only)

AI-Assisted Predictive Labor Demand Planning in Extended Warehouse Management (EWM)

AI-assisted predictive labor demand planning helps warehouse managers address labor shortages and increasing delivery demands by providing intelligent insights into workforce needs. By leveraging historical and real-time data, this feature calculates the planned duration of workload records and the required workload for outbound delivery orders. With short-term (next few days) and mid-term (next week) forecasts, managers can anticipate workload changes and adjust staffing accordingly. Interactive charts and key performance indicators (KPIs) allow users to monitor, analyze, and forecast labor demand, enabling better resource planning and more efficient warehouse operations.

Read more info here: AI-Assisted Predictive Labor Demand Planning

Core functional innovations

Alternative-Based Confirmation with Stock Transport Document Creation (aATP)

Alternative-Based Confirmation in Advanced Available-to-Promise (aATP) enhances the order fulfillment process by providing alternative solutions when stock is unavailable at the original source. When an item cannot be fulfilled from the requested location, the system identifies alternative sources and confirms availability from those locations. The process also involves the creation of a Stock Transport Document to ensure smooth transfer of stock between locations. This feature helps ensure that customers' orders are fulfilled on time, even when original stock is unavailable, thereby improving customer satisfaction and reducing delays.

Read more info here: Alternative-Based Confirmation with Stock Transport Document Creation

 

Cross-Delivery Handling Unit in the Advanced Shipping and Receiving Process (Transportation Management) 

The Cross-Delivery Handling Unit feature improves the advanced shipping and receiving process by allowing the grouping of multiple deliveries into a single handling unit. This streamlines logistics and enhances transportation efficiency by simplifying the management of goods. Users can track and manage multiple deliveries as a single unit, reducing the complexity of handling individual items separately. This functionality improves the visibility of shipments, simplifies the shipping process, and enables better control over logistics, even when managing complex scenarios across different locations.

Read more info here: Cross-Delivery Handling Unit in the Advanced Shipping and Receiving Process

Integration with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

The integration of Extended Warehouse Management (EWM) with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition enables the connection of on-premise warehouse management with cloud-based capabilities. This integration streamlines data synchronization between systems, ensuring real-time inventory updates, enhancing visibility, and improving operational efficiency. By leveraging this integration, businesses can optimize their warehouse processes, improve decision-making, and increase agility in responding to demand and supply fluctuations. This seamless data flow helps improve supply chain management and supports more effective scaling of warehouse operations.

Read more info here: Integration with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

 Production Planning-based Availability Check with Supply Creation-Based Confirmation

The Production Planning-based Availability Check with Supply Creation-Based Confirmation in Advanced Available-to-Promise (aATP) improves order fulfillment by aligning available production resources with customer demand. This feature leverages real-time production plans to perform availability checks, ensuring that if the required stock is not available, the system automatically generates supply to meet the demand. It then confirms the order based on the updated production plan, offering customers accurate delivery promises and improving overall production planning efficiency. By integrating availability checks with supply creation, this functionality helps businesses manage customer orders more effectively, even in complex production scenarios.

Read more info here: Production Planning-based Availability Check with Supply Creation-Based Confirmation

 

Service Management

AI-Powered Innovations (AI capabilities available in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition only)

Joule for Equipment Details, Summary, History, and Warranty Data

Joule helps service managers by providing a 360¬∞ view of services performed on equipment. It displays basic equipment details, such as its description and attached warranties for both customer and vendor. Users can also view the count of active and completed service transactions, including requests, contracts, orders, and confirmations. Additionally, Joule offers an AI-generated summary of the services performed on the equipment, highlighting completed, current, and planned services, parts replaced, and recurring issues. Based on this data, the system also provides recommendations to optimize service processes and ensure timely maintenance.

Read more info here: Joule for Service

 

Joule for Fetch, Complete, or Cancel Service Confirmation

Joule streamlines the service confirmation process by enabling users to fetch service confirmation details directly from the system. This feature helps service managers easily retrieve confirmation information for any service activities, ensuring accurate tracking of service progress. Additionally, Joule allows users to complete or cancel service confirmations with ease, helping ensure that service tasks are either marked as finished or appropriately canceled when needed. This capability helps businesses maintain accurate service records, improve efficiency, and enhance overall service management.

Read more info here: Joule for Fetch, Complete or Cancel Service Confirmation
Complete or Cancel Service Confirmations

Joule for Service Orders

Joule enhances service management by allowing users to search and display service orders efficiently. Service managers can quickly find relevant service orders based on various criteria, enabling faster decision-making and streamlined operations. Additionally, Joule supports the release of service orders and service order items, simplifying the process of making service orders active and ready for execution. By enabling seamless navigation and control over service orders, Joule helps businesses enhance service delivery and improve operational efficiency, ensuring that service requests are processed on time and accurately.

Read more info here: Joule for Service Orders ‚Äì Search and Display Service Orders
Release Service Orders and Service Order Items

Managing Service Contracts with Joule

Joule simplifies the management of service contracts by providing a copilot that enhances service contract workflows. With Joule, users can create, change, search, and cancel service contracts efficiently, reducing the time and effort spent on routine tasks. The copilot interface allows service managers to quickly navigate between functionalities and get specific answers on how to use service contracts within SAP S/4HANA. By utilizing natural language requests, users can manage service contract-related tasks seamlessly, making the process more intuitive and improving overall service delivery.

 

Core functional innovations

Intracompany Logistics for In-House Service Objects

The Intracompany logistics for in-house service objects feature streamlines the movement and management of service objects across different plants or storage locations within the same company code. It allows users to transfer service objects seamlessly between plants, making it easier to manage stock and service resources. Customers' stock can also be utilized for in-house service objects, providing flexibility in inventory management. With this feature, service objects can be received with a delivery, and users can define and display plant and storage locations for effective tracking. The process is simplified with a graphical flow, providing better visibility and control over logistics-related documents. Users can also easily choose between customer stock and returns order stock, receiving service objects from customers directly through inbound deliveries.

Read more info here: Intracompany logistics for in-house service objects

Plant and Storage Location in Service Transactions

The Plant and Storage Location functionality in service transactions allows users to efficiently manage service operations by specifying the plant and storage location for service objects. It helps ensure that the relevant materials, spare parts, or equipment are properly assigned to service transactions, ensuring smooth service execution. By defining the appropriate plant and storage location, businesses can streamline the process of allocating service resources, ensuring that the right materials are available when needed. This feature provides greater flexibility and control in managing service logistics and optimizes the overall service management process.

Read more info here: Plant and Storage Location in Service Transactions

Asset Management

AI-Powered Innovations (AI capabilities available in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition only)

Joule for Maintenance Planner and Maintenance Order Management*

With Joule, maintenance planners gain a powerful tool to optimize asset management and maintenance scheduling. By analyzing real-time data, Joule continuously suggests maintenance schedule adjustments, allowing for task reprioritization and improving overall asset health. It uses details from technical objects to automatically create maintenance planning buckets and align them with maintenance events. Planners can easily view upcoming maintenance events, which are already tied to relevant maintenance orders and notifications. Additionally, Joule allows for the assignment of maintenance orders and notifications directly to these events. The system also checks available slots in production planning, ensuring that work center capacities are blocked for any new operations suggested, optimizing the scheduling process and preventing any scheduling conflicts.

Read more info here: perform-maintenance-jobs , Display Maintenance Orders and Maintenance Notifications and Maintenance Events 

*Beta Shipment, GA planned

Enabling Navigation to Scheduling Apps through Joule

Joule enhances the user experience by enabling maintenance planners to seamlessly navigate to SAP S/4HANA Asset Management scheduling apps without having to search through the catalog. This integration simplifies access to relevant apps, allowing planners to directly launch resource scheduling (RSH) apps from a natural language request. For example, a simple query like ‚ÄúHow to visualize maintenance work‚Äù will immediately direct the user to the relevant scheduling app. Additionally, Joule can provide SAP Help documentation within the conversation, offering guidance and support on how to use the scheduling apps effectively, ensuring a more efficient and streamlined workflow.

Core functional innovations

Additional Features for the Manage Maintenance Order App

The Manage Maintenance Order app in SAP S/4HANA has been enhanced with additional features to improve the efficiency of maintenance planning and execution. These features provide maintenance teams with better visibility and control over the order lifecycle. Users can now easily track maintenance orders and their status, ensuring that all relevant details are updated and accessible. The app enables the management of service notifications, the assignment of maintenance tasks to specific work centers, and the ability to adjust scheduling as needed. It also allows users to monitor the progress of maintenance orders, improving decision-making and ensuring timely completion of tasks. These updates streamline maintenance processes and improve asset reliability, ultimately enhancing operational efficiency.

Read more info here: Additional Features for the Manage Maintenance Order App

Spatial Data Explorer: Creating Geo-Objects for Notifications and Orders Based on Phases and Subphases

The feature allows users to create geo-objects based on the processing context, phase, and sub-phases of business objects such as Maintenance Notifications and Maintenance Orders. This functionality enables the visualization of these notifications and orders on a map according to the new phase model, enhancing the spatial representation of maintenance activities and improving overall operational planning.

Assigning Person Responsible from the Maintenance Scheduling Board

This feature allows maintenance planners to create and manage the assignment of the person responsible directly from the maintenance scheduling board. It enables users to maintain or change personnel assignments within a single app, eliminating the need to navigate to different apps or screens, streamlining the process and improving efficiency in scheduling and task management.

Procurement

AI-Powered Innovations (AI capabilities available in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition only)

AI-Assisted Creation of Purchase Requisitions

AI-assisted creation of purchase requisitions enables procurement teams to streamline their requisition processes by leveraging AI to predict and automate the creation of purchase requisitions. The system analyzes historical data, inventory levels, and demand patterns to generate requisitions for the required materials. By automating this task, businesses can save time, reduce manual errors, and improve procurement efficiency, ensuring that materials are ordered at the right time and in the right quantities. This also supports better inventory management and timely procurement to meet business needs.

Read more info here: AI-Assisted Creation of Purchase Requisitions

Purchase Order Changes with Joule

The Purchase Order Changes feature in Procurement, powered by Joule, enables users to efficiently manage and modify existing purchase orders. Leveraging the power of AI, Joule assists users in making changes to key details such as delivery dates, quantities, and prices directly from within the purchase order. Joule‚Äôs intelligent suggestions help streamline the change process by automatically adjusting related documents and data across the system, ensuring real-time consistency. This functionality helps procurement teams quickly adapt to changes, ensuring smoother operations and improved responsiveness to evolving business needs.

Read more info here: Purchase Order Changes

Transfer to Lean Services from MM-SRV

The Transfer to Lean Services from MM-SRV feature enables the smooth migration of documents from classic MM-SRV (Materials Management for Services) to Lean Services in SAP S/4HANA. This process allows businesses to transition from the traditional service procurement model to the streamlined Lean Services approach. It facilitates the automated conversion of Purchase Orders (PO) and Contracts by mapping them to the corresponding Lean Service document types. If no mapping exists, the system logs an error and skips the affected document, which requires manual follow-up. This functionality supports the migration process, ensuring that the transition from MM-SRV to Lean Services is as efficient and error-free as possible.

Read more info here: Transfer to Lean Services from MM-SRV

Custom Split Criteria for Central Purchase Contracts

The Custom Split Criteria for Central Purchase Contracts feature allows businesses to customize central purchase contracts based on document types, either within a specific connected system or across all connected systems. This functionality enables users to activate or deactivate configuration settings as needed. There are two primary options for configuring custom split criteria for central contracts: first, splitting items into single outline agreements (contract or scheduling agreement), and second, splitting central contracts based on custom criteria such as plant or storage location. Additionally, custom fields can be used as criteria to further refine how central contracts are split. This flexibility allows businesses to streamline the distribution process, facilitating easy call-offs by splitting central contracts based on plant and storage location. Furthermore, the use of custom fields to define splitting criteria enhances efficiency and scalability by aligning with specific business requirements.

Read more info here: Custom Split Criteria for Central Purchase Contracts

Manufacturing

Core functional innovations

Using the New Accept MRP Result Button

The "Accept MRP Result" button allows material planners to flag individual segments as processed in the Manage Material Coverage app when a problem cannot be resolved or when the production planner decides not to address the issue. This functionality includes a new filter field in the Monitor Material Coverage app for easier tracking, and also provides the option to "Revoke MRP result" if the planner wants to reconsider a previous decision. By implementing this feature, MRP controllers can work more efficiently, particularly when managing material coverage issues for around 3,000 materials between two MRP runs per day, streamlining decision-making and improving overall productivity.

Read more info here: Using the new Accept MRP Result button

Business Transaction Events (BTE) During an MRP Live Run

The Business Transaction Events (BTE) in MRP Live feature enables materials relevant for SAP Integrated Business Planning (SAP IBP) or Production Planning and Detailed Scheduling (PP/DS) integration to be planned using MRP live, followed by triggering BTEs for documents created during post-processing. Previously, BTEs were not supported in MRP live for such materials, meaning even when MRP Live was used, the planning was handled in classic ABAP mode. With this update, BTE events are now triggered during the MRP Live run, improving performance by avoiding unnecessary data transfers between the database and application server. A new field, Planning for IBP/PPDS Material, has been introduced in the transaction PPHMRPSET, allowing users to select the planning mode for materials in IBP/PPDS integration. This provides two options: In HANA Live, where material planning is executed using SQL-script procedures, and In MRP Classic, where planning and BTE triggering are done using ABAP logic. By default, the value is set to "In MRP Classic," but selecting "In HANA Live" enables this feature. Notably, materials with MRP Type X0 will still use classic MRP and remain unaffected by this setting.

Read more info here: Business Transaction Events in MRP Live

New App: Adjust Fill Levels

The Adjust Fill Levels app allows warehouse managers to maintain the correct stock levels by adjusting the fill level of containers based on real-time data. This ensures optimal inventory control and avoids issues related to under- or overstocking. The app enables users to update the fill levels for packaging materials or transport containers, ensuring accurate stock information is available for efficient operations. By providing an easy-to-use interface for adjusting these levels, it helps businesses maintain efficient warehouse operations and avoid unnecessary stock discrepancies.

Read more info here: New App: Adjust Fill Levels

Ability to Create Shop Floor Order for Repair & Parallel Sequences in Routing

The ability to create a shop floor order for repairs based on rework BOM and shop floor routing allows businesses to manage product repairs or rework activities efficiently. It enables the creation of BOMs and shop floor routings tailored for part repairs, facilitating the creation of shop floor orders for these repair activities. These orders can be adjusted to modify operational activities or components as needed. By enabling repairs for parts that may need rework due to damage, maintenance, or upgrades, businesses can streamline the process for managing completed production orders that require engineering changes or replacement of defective parts. Additionally, the ability to create parallel sequences in shop floor routing empowers production engineers to plan and execute operations simultaneously within the same routing. This flexibility reduces production time, optimizes resource utilization, and supports varied manufacturing scenarios, improving both efficiency and adaptability in production planning.

Read more info here: Ability to Create Shop Floor Order for Repair Based on Rework BOM and Shop Floor Routing & Creating Parallel Sequences in Shop Floor Routing

Managing Master Manufacturing BOM & Shop Floor Routing for Unitized Material

The "Manage Production Model-Materials" app enables users to create or edit production models for unitized materials, incorporating both the manufacturing bill of materials (MBOM) and shop floor routing in a single workflow. This approach simplifies the management of both MBOM and shop floor routing, providing a unified view for handling unitized products. By consolidating these elements into one app, businesses reduce the risk of errors and enhance the overall oversight of production processes, improving efficiency and accuracy in managing unitized material production.

Read more info here: Manage Production Model-Materials

R & D and Engineering

EPPM: Intelligent Project Assistant Capabilities with Joule

The intelligent project assistant capabilities in Joule enhance user experience by enabling users to retrieve project-related information through natural language processing, eliminating the need to manually open applications. This feature supports a range of tasks, including informational, navigational, and transactional capabilities, such as easily finding and opening apps to display project data. Users can get real-time updates on project changes, missing parts, or overdue activities directly within Joule, and open projects, WBS elements, or networks for viewing or editing through the Project Builder or dedicated object pages.

Read more info here: Project Assistant Capabilities for the Joule Copilot

Joule Support for Bill of Materials

Joule, powered by natural language AI, enhances user interaction by supporting both navigational and transactional scenarios for Bill of Materials (BoM). Users can easily access header information for BoMs and query specific BoMs based on material-plant combinations. Additionally, Joule simplifies the process of selecting and opening relevant BoMs directly in the appropriate application.

Read more info here: Joule Support for Bill of Materials

Joule Support for Change Record

Joule, the natural language AI assistant, enhances the change record process by supporting both navigational and transactional scenarios. It simplifies the user experience by enabling access to general information about specific change records or groups of change records, at both the header and item levels. Joule also allows users to summarize change records, including descriptions, texts, and included entities, while facilitating the identification of overdue change records and enabling status changes. By offering a streamlined way to find similar records based on criteria like product, description, relevance, and reason for change, Joule accelerates the change process and ensures compliance.

Read more info here: Joule Support for Change Record

Links Between Change Records in SAP PLM

This feature in SAP PLM provides enhanced transparency on changes by allowing users to link change records. It enables the definition of possible relationships between different change records, helping to document dependencies or relations for each record. For example, if change record types like problem reports and change requests are configured in the system, users can create a "resolved by" link between a problem report and the engineering change request that resolves it. This functionality ensures compliance with change management processes, while improving traceability and transparency through clear documentation of relationships and dependencies.

Read more info here: Links Between Change Records

EPPM: Simplified Object-Based Authorizations for Project System

The new feature for simplified object-based authorizations in the Project System helps to streamline and optimize authorization management for projects and related objects such as WBS elements and networks. It simplifies the maintenance process of object-based authorizations and enhances system performance during the evaluation of these authorizations. This ensures faster and more efficient authorization checks for project-related activities, enabling project managers and users to focus on their tasks without delays in access control.

Read more info here: Simplified Object-Based Authorizations for Project System

Product Compliance

Compliance Assessment Using Documents for Evaluation of Articles

This feature supports compliance for discrete industries by leveraging up-to-date content, such as substance lists and assessments, to evaluate the marketability of products based on regulations like the Restriction of Hazardous Substances (RoHS) directive. Manufacturers can use this capability to ensure that their products comply with regulatory requirements, which is crucial for maintaining marketability in regulated markets. The key benefits include the ability to use embedded regulatory content for decision-making, view the aggregated compliance status of purchased components, collect and consolidate compliance documents, and access market assessments from logistics processes. Additionally, this feature ensures auditable storage of compliance information for product marketability.

Read more info here: Compliance Assessment Using Documents for Evaluation of Articles

Supporting Multi-Component Products for Safety Data Sheet Process

This feature enables the ability to send safety data sheets (SDS) for multiple components of a product simultaneously, streamlining the compliance process. By supporting multi-component products, businesses can ensure that all relevant components are covered under safety data sheet regulations at once, enhancing the overall efficiency of regulatory compliance.

Automated Enclosure Variant Suggestions for Packaged Dangerous Goods

This feature automatically suggests the appropriate enclosure variants for packaged dangerous goods based on the selected UN-certified packaging, such as Intermediate Bulk Containers (IBC), Large Packaging (LP), UN Bulk Containers, or UN Portable Tanks. It also improves the configuration table for "Specify Descriptions of Dangerous Goods Packages," enhancing how enclosure variants and intermediate packaging are determined. This streamlined process simplifies the data maintenance for dangerous goods regulatory information, ensuring greater accuracy and compliance with packaging regulations.

Business Add-In to Complete Safety Data Sheet Generation

This feature allows businesses to upload base Safety Data Sheets (SDS), such as raw reports generated by the classic SAP Product Safety application, into the SDS management solution using the Safety Data Sheet Assessment public API. It offers the flexibility to choose the method for final SDS generation, such as utilizing the classic functionality with a business add-in. By integrating these capabilities with SAP S/4HANA for product compliance, the process enhances efficiency and ensures seamless integration with legacy systems, while improving the overall SDS management workflow.

Integration of Dangerous Goods Mixed Loading Checks in Sales, Delivery, and Transportation Management
This feature integrates dangerous goods mixed loading checks throughout the value chain, including sales orders, outbound deliveries, and freight units, orders, and bookings. By enforcing these checks, businesses can ensure that dangerous goods are loaded and transported in compliance with safety regulations. This prevents the execution of noncompliant transports, helping organizations avoid costly penalties and potential safety risks associated with improper handling of dangerous goods.

 

Business-Ready Data for Smarter Decisions

A key enabler in this release is the integration with SAP Business Data Cloud, which provides a governed and harmonized data layer across SAP and third-party systems. This unified foundation supports planning, analytics, and AI use cases‚Äîensuring that business teams can work with trusted, real-time data across processes. Check here: integration with SAP Business Data Cloud.

The release also delivers a growing portfolio of data products tailored to specific business domains:

  • Billing and Invoicing: Data products for billing requests and documents support near-real-time dashboards and analytics.
  • Financial Operations: Contract accounting data products enable deeper insights into provider contracts and accounting documents.
  • Subscription Models: Subscription-related data products help track orders, contracts, and agreements for recurring revenue scenarios.
  • Manufacturing Insights: Unified data for production orders, confirmations, and work centers helps optimize shop floor operations. Consult our SAP Help portal.
  • Product Lifecycle: Enhanced data products for BOMs and engineering changes support better product and change management. For more information, click here.

For a full overview of available data products, visit the Business Accelerator Hub. 

Thank you for engaging with this blog post‚Äîyour attention is truly appreciated!

entry.title: Story Reports ‚Äì Combine Holiday and Timesheet data without a direct query relationship
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I am building a monthly Timesheet Story Report in SAP SuccessFactors Report Center, based on the Recorded Time Data (V2) query.

Goal:
Generate a monthly timesheet per employee, showing all attendance and absence types ‚Äî with columns such as:

  • Date
  • Start Time
  • End Time
  • Quantity in hours
  • Time Type (working time, vacation, sick leave, holiday, etc.)

Problem:
The Recorded Time Data (V2) table does not contain entries for public holidays.
The Holiday data exists separately and can only be reached through the User ‚Üí Employee Information ‚Üí Job Information path.
However, when trying to connect those datasets in Story Reports, the query expands uncontrollably ‚Äî generating huge amounts of redundant data, to the point where nothing meaningful can be displayed or analyzed.

I have checked all other available query tables and possible combinations ‚Äî there are no tables that can directly connect or combine both employee timesheet (Recorded Time Data) and holiday information in a way that provides usable, consistent data.

Additional context:

  • No Time Tracking license ‚Üí cannot use Time Valuations.
  • Absence Counting Configuration is not useful for this case.
  • I only need this for reporting (not payroll integration).

Questions:

  1. Is there any supported way to bring Recorded Time Data (V2) and Holiday data together into the same Story Report?
    For example, can this be achieved if I add both tables as two separate data sources, where the only common field between them is the Date column (without any direct relationship through Employee or Job Information)?
  2. Can I use any formula or calculated column in Recorded Time Data to identify or return Holiday dates?

Any ideas, workarounds, or model design suggestions would be highly appreciated.

Thank you in advance!

entry.title: Re: Need guidance on Bank reconciliation
entry.content:
Hi Nithin,
Yes, you are correct. Please find the steps for Bank Reconciliation in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud (Simplified Flow).

1. Set Up House Bank and Bank Accounts
Use the Manage Bank Accounts Fiori app.
Define House Bank & Bank Account (linked to a G/L account of type Cash Account with subtype B ‚Äì Bank Reconciliation Account)

2. Create G/L Accounts
Create main bank reconciliation account (Subtype B) and Bank Subaccounts (Subtype S) for incoming/outgoing payments.
These are defined using the Manage G/L Account Master Data app.

3. Configure Bank Statement Processing
Use the Manage Automatic Bank Statement Rules app.
Define external transaction codes (e.g., NTRF, NCHK) and Posting rules that map to G/L accounts
(It is the replacement of OT83/OT52 from on-premises.)

4. Import Bank Statements
Use Import Bank Statements app to upload MT940 or CAMT.053 files. You can alternatively, set up Bank Communication Management for automatic uploads.

5. Monitor and Process Statements
Use Reprocess Bank Statement Items or Postprocess Bank Statement Items apps.
System auto-clears matched items.
Unmatched items can be manually assigned or posted.

6. Clear Open Items
Use Clear Bank Subaccounts or Manage Journal Entries to manually clear if needed.
Ensure all subaccounts are reconciled with the main bank account.

7. Review Reconciliation Reports
Use Cash Flow Analyzer or Bank Statement Monitor for visibility.
Confirm balances match between SAP and actual bank.

I hope it will help you

entry.title: Configuration of Fiori app state for sharing
entry.content:
1. Introduction

When using Fiori apps in business settings, users often enter search conditions such as specific date ranges or company codes, adjust the order of lists, and then share the app URL with other users via the ‚ÄúShare‚Äù button‚Äîeither by email or chat. However, when the recipient opens the shared URL, the filters may be reset or the sorting order may revert, so the sender‚Äôs screen cannot be reproduced. This behavior occurs when accessing from different browsers (e.g., Chrome to Edge), different devices (PC to smartphone), or different sessions. As a result, the recipient may have to ask for the filter conditions again or manually restore the conditions by comparing with screenshots, which can slow down reviews, approvals, or troubleshooting. The cause of this issue lies in the default settings of Fiori Launchpad. By default, the application state (such as filters, sorting, and pagination) is stored in the browser‚Äôs temporary storage, so simply sharing the URL will not reflect the filter conditions and other settings. Therefore, even if you open the URL in a different environment, the information saved in the sender‚Äôs browser is not referenced, and even if the ‚Äúsap-iapp-state‚Äù parameter is included in the URL, the screen cannot be reproduced. This blog introduces how to configure the system so that information such as filter conditions and table column order can be shared across different browsers or devices.



2. Mechanism for Sharing App State

The state of the app is managed by Application State data. Application State data is the "app appearance and filtering state" in Fiori Launchpad.This is the data that handles the data. When a user sets filter conditions or adjusts the order and display columns of the table, the state is recorded as a collective "snapshot" and restored later. For apps that use Fiori elements and SmartFilterBar, the app state is stored and loaded through this Application State data. The Fiori app uses the reference key ("sap-iapp-state" parameter) given to the URL to reproduce the state of the app. The handling method of Application State data in Fiori Launchpad is defined in the Launchpad configuration parameter: APPSTATE_TRANSIENT, and the following two types of parameters are provided.

  • true (default)

    It is a method of maintaining state in a temporary area in the browser (transient). Only the same browser and the same session are maintained, so they cannot be reproduced in different browsers or devices.

  • false

    Save the state of the app on the front-end server. Therefore, it is possible to refer to the data stored on the front-end server, allowing the app to be reproduced across different browsers and devices.

3. How to set it up

In one of the following transactions, set the Launchpad configuration parameter: APPSTATE_TRANSIENT (value: true / false).

  • T-cd: /UI2/FLP_CUS_CONF(For client-dependent settings)
  • T-cd: /UI2/FLP_SYS_CONF(For client-independent settings)

 

4. Notes

Launchpad configuration parameters: If the APPSTATE_TRANSIENT is set to false, the Application State data is stored on the server, so regular cleanup is required in terms of server load and performance. Data cleanup can be performed from Cleanup Layered Repository Files (T-cd: /UIF/CLEAN_LREP). The cleanup run requires the following parameter settings: (You can't access the cleaned up Application State data.)

  • Maximum number of times readÔºöThe maximum number of accesses to the Application State data to be deleted (If set to 0, data that has never been accessed is included.)
  • Minimum number of days not accessedÔºöThe minimum number of days since the last access (if set to 30, data that has not been accessed in 30 days is eligible.)

For more information: SAP Help: Cleanup of Expired Application State

5. Summary

Launchpad configuration parameters: You can set the APPSTATE_TRANSIENT to false to share the state of the app (filter criteria, sorting, pagination, etc.) between different browsers and devices. On the other hand, if the APPSTATE_TRANSIENT is set to false, the Application State data is stored on the server, which requires regular cleanup in terms of server load and performance.



6. References

SAP Help: Launchpad Configuration Parameters
SAP KBA: 3260742 - Fiori appstate is not persisted across browser sessions
SAP Help: Cleanup of Expired Application State

entry.title: File upload for items in Fiori Elements List Report
entry.content:
1. Introduction

In this blog, we'll show you how to upload, browse, and delete files on a row-by-line basis by having each row (item) have an item like an "attachment" in the SAP Fiori Elements List Report.
The data source for the List Report covers OData V4 services developed using the ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model (RAP) framework, and provides information about the implementation required to achieve file upload in RAP development.

 

2. Key points for implementing file upload

In the file upload implementation, two points are required: (1) define the table items required for file storage, and (2) provide appropriate annotations for file object storage fields and file type storage fields.

  1. Defining the table items required to store files

    Set the following three fields in the custom table (the field names are samples).

    • File object storage field (abap.rawstring(0) if file size is not specified)
      • exampleÔºöattachment: abap.rawstring(0);
    • Field for file name
      • exampleÔºöfilename: abap.char(128);
    • Field for file Type
      • exampleÔºömimetype: abap.char(128);
  2. Proper Annotation of File Object and File Type Fields in CDS View
    • File object storage field
      • exampleÔºö
@Semantics.largeObject : {
mimeType: 'Mimetype',
fileName: 'Filename',
contentDispositionPreference: #INLINE
}‚Äã
    • Field for file Type
      • @Semantics.mimeType: true

3. Implementation sample

In this blog, we will use the RAP Generator to simplify RAP development. RAP Generator is a tool that allows you to generate RAP objects such as CDS View and Behavior Definition from custom tables using only wizard settings. When using the RAP Generator to generate a RAP object, a service is generated that supports the Managed Runtime with a draft function. Therefore, the table definition must define the required fields for drafting functions and update processing. For more information about RAP Generator, please check the following SAP Help.

Generating a RAP Business Service with the Generate ABAP Repository Objects Wizards

This blog is an example implementation based on the SAP Help: Example: OData UI Service Generation Based on a Database Table

 

1. Create a package to store objects by the RAP Generator.

2. Create a custom table inside the package you created in 1.



 

@EndUserText.label : 'Custom Table for file upload test'
@AbapCatalog.enhancement.category : #NOT_EXTENSIBLE
@AbapCatalog.tableCategory : #TRANSPARENT
@AbapCatalog.deliveryClass : #A
@AbapCatalog.dataMaintenance : #RESTRICTED
define table zpt_file_upload {

  key client            : abap.clnt not null;
  key customer_id       : /dmo/customer_id not null;
  first_name            : /dmo/first_name;
  last_name             : /dmo/last_name;
  title                 : /dmo/title;
  street                : /dmo/street;
  postal_code           : /dmo/postal_code;
  city                  : /dmo/city;
  country_code          : land1;
  phone_number          : /dmo/phone_number;
  email_address         : /dmo/email_address;
  attachment            : abap.rawstring(0);
  filename              : abap.char(128);
  mimetype              : abap.char(128);
  local_created_by      : abp_creation_user;
  local_created_at      : abp_creation_tstmpl;
  local_last_changed_by : abp_locinst_lastchange_user;
  local_last_changed_at : abp_locinst_lastchange_tstmpl;
  last_changed_at       : abp_lastchange_tstmpl;

}‚Äã

 

3. Run the RAP Generator and follow the wizard to configure it.

Right-click on the target custom table ‚Üí run it with "Generate ABAP Repository Objects..."

 

 

Selecting a Service Type

 

 

Selecting a package for storing generated objects

 

 

Review the generated object and rename or alias it as needed


 

4. Add annotations for file upload to the generated data model (CDS View) and enable the CDS View.

@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #CHECK
@EndUserText.label: '##GENERATED ZPT_FILE_UPLOAD'
define root view entity ZR_PT_FILE_UPLOAD
  as select from zpt_file_upload
{
  key customer_id           as CustomerID,
      first_name            as FirstName,
      last_name             as LastName,
      title                 as Title,
      street                as Street,
      postal_code           as PostalCode,
      city                  as City,
      country_code          as CountryCode,
      phone_number          as PhoneNumber,
      email_address         as EmailAddress,
      @Semantics.largeObject : {
            mimeType: 'Mimetype',
            fileName: 'Filename',
            contentDispositionPreference: #INLINE
          }
      attachment            as Attachment,
      filename              as Filename,
      @Semantics.mimeType: true
      mimetype              as Mimetype,
      @Semantics.user.createdBy: true
      local_created_by      as LocalCreatedBy,
      @Semantics.systemDateTime.createdAt: true
      local_created_at      as LocalCreatedAt,
      @Semantics.user.localInstanceLastChangedBy: true
      local_last_changed_by as LocalLastChangedBy,
      @Semantics.systemDateTime.localInstanceLastChangedAt: true
      local_last_changed_at as LocalLastChangedAt,
      @Semantics.systemDateTime.lastChangedAt: true
      last_changed_at       as LastChangedAt

}

5. Publish the service binding.

 

6. Select the entity and preview it.

 

7. From the "Create" button, perform data registration and file upload.







 

4. Summary

By implementing the above, using the OData V4 service using the ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model (RAP), you can use the "Attachment" for each row (item) in the SAP Fiori Elements List Report. It is possible to upload, read, and delete files on a line-by-line basis. Please take advantage of it.

 

References

SAPUI5 Document: Enabling Stream Support
